data.title: Media Photos 2015-2016
data.text:
Roger (Brett Dixon) and Mimi (Taylor Pearlstein) in the musical number “Trusting Desire” in RENT presented by UA Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Filmmaker Mark (Austin Wright), who aspires to shoot without a script in RENT, presented by UA Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Maureen (Sarah Ambrose) and Joanne (Rhetta Mykeal) sing the passionate and gritty song “Take Me or Leave Me” in RENT, presented by UA Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

The cast of UA Arizona Repertory Theatre’s rock musical, RENT. Back row from left to right: Mark (Austin Wright), Mimi (Taylor Pearlstein), and Roger (Brett Dixon). Front row from left to right: Tom Collins (Matthew Osvog), Angel (Josh Dunn), Maureen (Sarah Ambrose), & Joanne (Rhetta Mykeal – photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Prospero (Kevin Black) confronts the monster, Caliban (Charlie Hall), in Arizona Repertory Theatre’s production of THE TEMPEST by William Shakespeare (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Sebastian (Scott Murdock) and Gonzalo (Claire Mannle) pay homage to Prospero (Kevin Black) in THE TEMPEST by William Shakespeare, running at Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Prospero (Kevin Black) commands the winds and sea in THE TEMPEST by William Shakespeare at Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Caliban (Charlie Hall), Prospero (Kevin Black) and Miranda (Tyler Reaser) during better times in Arizona Repertory Theatre’s production of THE TEMPEST by William Shakespeare (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Nothing like two sets of twins with the same names, but from different towns, to spice up a reunion. From left to right: Antipholus of Syracuse (Kasey Caruso), Luciana (Cera Naccarato), Dromio of Syracuse (Keenan Larson), Dromio of Ephesus (Connor Griffin), Adriana (Jaclyn Stickel) and Antipholus of Ephesus (Ethan Kirschbaum) in Arizona Repertory Theatre’s production, THE COMEDY OF ERRORS (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

What could possibly go wrong with two sets of twins – Dromio of Ephesus (Connor Griffin), Antipholus of Ephesus (Ethan Kirschbaum), Antipholus of Syracuse (Kasey Caruso) and Dromio of Syracuse (Keenan Larson) – who were separated at birth, but find themselves grown up in the same town that’s renowned for sorcery? (Photo by Ed Flores.)

[View Full-sized Image]

A cat fight breaks out between Adriana (Jaclyn Stickel) and Luciana (Cera Naccarato) while Antipholus of Syracuse (Kasey Caruso) and Antipholus of Ephesus (Ethan Kirschbaum) attempt to break it up in the madcap Shakespeare play, THE COMEDY OF ERRORS, presented by Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Antipholus of Ephesus (Ethan Kirschbaum) attempts to clobber Dromio of Ephesus (Connor Griffin) on the steps as Dromio of Syracuse (Keenan Larson) postures a weak block by a vase-wielding Antipholus of Syracuse (Kasey Caruso) in Shakespeare’s THE COMEDY OF ERRORS presented by Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Sentimental dreamer Rachel (Grace Kirkpatrick) gets nostalgic about past Christmases in the demented but delightful play, RECKLESS, by Craig Lucas, playing Nov 8 – Dec 6, 2015 at UA Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Lloyd (Scott Murdock) and Rachel (Grace Kirkpatrick) embark on a cross-country odyssey, unshaken by disaster in RECKLESS, a dark “holiday” comedy running Nov 8 – Dec 6, 2015 at UA Arizona Repertory Theatre (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Pooty (Jamie Grossman) and her husband, Lloyd (Scott Murdock), are just as excited giving their gift as Rachel (Grace Kirkpatrick) is to receive it in the darkly funny play, RECKLESS, presented by UA Arizona Repertory Theatre from Nov 8 – Dec 6, 2015 (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Rachel (Grace Kirkpatrick), Pooty (Jamie Grossman) and Lloyd (Scott Murdock) are all contestants on a wacky game show, hosted by an even wackier game show host (Ethan Kirschbaum) in UA Arizona Repertory Theatre’s production of RECKLESS (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

The gender-bending Emcee (Josh Dunn) of UA Arizona Repertory Theatre’s sizzling production of Kander and Ebb’s CABARET, running Oct 18 – Nov 8, 2015 (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Sally Bowles (Ali Wood Moser) and her performing cohorts of Berlin’s early 1930’s Kit Kat Klub entice you to forget your cares in CABARET, presented by UA Arizona Repertory Theatre, Oct 18 – Nov 8, 2015 (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

Cliff Bradshaw (Brian Klimowski) steps into a foreign land with hope of finding inspiration for his next novel in CABARET, presented by UA Arizona Repertory Theatre, running Oct 18 – Nov 8, 2015 (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]

A sultry Sally Bowles (Ali Wood Moser) poses in UA Arizona Repertory Theatre’s production of CABARET, playing Oct 18 – Nov 8, 2015, directed by Danny Gurwin & choreographed by Broadway’s own Mark Esposito (photo by Ed Flores).

[View Full-sized Image]
